summary:
• Revenue milestone: FY revenue exceeded $200M for the first time ($208M total sales).
  • Core market strength: Australasia delivered $181M in sales, supporting $300M FY27 revenue target.
  • North American expansion:
  • Launched Maxigesic IV/tablet (Combogesic) in the US and Canada (combined addressable market >US$8B).
  • Restructured US distribution to optimize postoperative care sales.
  • Pipeline progress:
  • 8 patented products in R&D, 24 off-patent injectables, and 5 advanced programs entering commercialization (e.g., Crystaderm, Micolette).
  • Financials:
  • Net debt reduced to $14.5M (from $16.2M).
  • Dividend increased to 1.8 cents/share (from 1.6 cents).
  • Share price concerns: Management believes the share price undervalues growth potential and pipeline.
  • Challenges: FY25 saw temporary headwinds (client destocking, doctors’ strike), but H2 recovery occurred.

No material capital markets actions (e.g., raising, trading halts) identified.

Summary of ASX Announcement: AFT Pharmaceuticals 2025 Annual Shareholders' Meeting Presentation

Key Financial Highlights

  • FY25 Revenue: NZ$208.0M (+6% YoY), with 5-year CAGR of 14%.
  • ANZ Sales: NZ$180.9M (87% of total).
  • Operating Profit: NZ$17.6M (down from NZ$24.2M in FY24) due to lower license income and strategic investments.
  • Dividend: 1.8cps (up from 1.6cps in FY24).
  • Net Debt: NZ$14.5M (down from NZ$16.2M in FY24).
  • FY27 Target: Revenue of NZ$300M.

Operational & Strategic Updates

  • International Expansion:
  • Products sold in ~80 countries; active R&D pipeline of 8 patented products.
  • Launches in UK/EU (Combogesic IV), North America, Asia, and Africa.
  • R&D Progress:
  • 24+ injectable products and 5 commercialized R&D programs; key focus on Maxigesic variants (oral/IV) and dermatology (Crystaderm).
  • Market-Specific Performance:
  • Australia: +17% growth (eyecare/pain relief).
  • Asia: Disrupted by Korean doctors’ strike.

Outlook

  • FY26 operating profit guidance: NZ$20M–NZ$24M.
  • Focus on geographic and product diversification to drive growth.

No capital raising, trading halt, or material M&A disclosed.
